t: John 1
The Word Became Flesh
In*p the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God.
He was in the beginning with God.
All things were made through him, and without him was not any thing made that was made.
In him was life, and the life was the light of men.
The light shines in the darkness, and the darkness has not overcome it.
There*p was a man sent from God, whose name was John.
He came as a witness, to bear witness about the light, that all might believe through him.
He was not the light, but came to bear witness about the light.
The*p true light, which gives light to everyone, was coming into the world.
He was in the world, and the world was made through him, yet the world did not know him.
He came to his own, and his own people did not receive him.
But to all who did receive him, who believed in his name, he gave the right to become children of God,
who were born, not of blood nor of the will of the flesh nor of the will of man, but of God.
And*p the Word became flesh and dwelt among us, and we have seen his glory, glory as of the only Son from the Father, full of grace and truth.
(John bore witness about him, and cried out, “This was he of whom I said, ‘He who comes after me ranks before me, because he was before me.’”)
For from his fullness we have all received, grace upon grace.
For the law was given through Moses; grace and truth came through Jesus Christ.
No one has ever seen God; the only God, who is at the Father’s side, he has made him known.
The Testimony of John the Baptist
And*p this is the testimony of John, when the Jews sent priests and Levites from Jerusalem to ask him, “Who are you?”
He confessed, and did not deny, but confessed, “I am not the Christ.”
And they asked him, “What then? Are you Elijah?” He said, “I am not.” “Are you the Prophet?” And he answered, “No.”
So they said to him, “Who are you? We need to give an answer to those who sent us. What do you say about yourself?”
He said, “I am the voice of one crying out in the wilderness, ‘Make straight the way of the Lord,’ as the prophet Isaiah said.”
(Now*p they had been sent from the Pharisees.)
They asked him, “Then why are you baptizing, if you are neither the Christ, nor Elijah, nor the Prophet?”
John answered them, “I baptize with water, but among you stands one you do not know,
even he who comes after me, the strap of whose sandal I am not worthy to untie.”
These things took place in Bethany across the Jordan, where John was baptizing.
Behold, the Lamb of God
The*p next day he saw Jesus coming toward him, and said, “Behold, the Lamb of God, who takes away the sin of the world!
This is he of whom I said, ‘After me comes a man who ranks before me, because he was before me.’
I myself did not know him, but for this purpose I came baptizing with water, that he might be revealed to Israel.”
And John bore witness: “I saw the Spirit descend from heaven like a dove, and it remained on him.
I myself did not know him, but he who sent me to baptize with water said to me, ‘He on whom you see the Spirit descend and remain, this is he who baptizes with the Holy Spirit.’
And I have seen and have borne witness that this is the Son of God.”
Jesus Calls the First Disciples
The*p next day again John was standing with two of his disciples,
and he looked at Jesus as he walked by and said, “Behold, the Lamb of God!”
The two disciples heard him say this, and they followed Jesus.
Jesus turned and saw them following and said to them, “What*r are*r you*r seeking?”*r And they said to him, “Rabbi” (which means Teacher), “where are you staying?”
He said to them, “Come*r and*r you*r will*r see.”*r So they came and saw where he was staying, and they stayed with him that day, for it was about the tenth hour.
One of the two who heard John speak and followed Jesus was Andrew, Simon Peter’s brother.
He first found his own brother Simon and said to him, “We have found the Messiah” (which means Christ).
He brought him to Jesus. Jesus looked at him and said, “You*r are*r Simon*r the*r son*r of*r John.*r You*r shall*r be*r called*r Cephas”*r (which means Peter).
Jesus Calls Philip and Nathanael
The*p next day Jesus decided to go to Galilee. He found Philip and said to him, “Follow*r me.”*r
Now Philip was from Bethsaida, the city of Andrew and Peter.
Philip found Nathanael and said to him, “We have found him of whom Moses in the Law and also the prophets wrote, Jesus of Nazareth, the son of Joseph.”
Nathanael said to him, “Can anything good come out of Nazareth?” Philip said to him, “Come and see.”
Jesus saw Nathanael coming toward him and said of him, “Behold,*r an*r Israelite*r indeed,*r in*r whom*r there*r is*r no*r deceit!”*r
Nathanael said to him, “How do you know me?” Jesus answered him, “Before*r Philip*r called*r you,*r when*r you*r were*r under*r the*r fig*r tree,*r I*r saw*r you.”*r
Nathanael answered him, “Rabbi, you are the Son of God! You are the King of Israel!”
Jesus answered him, “Because*r I*r said*r to*r you,*r ‘I*r saw*r you*r under*r the*r fig*r tree,’*r do*r you*r believe?*r You*r will*r see*r greater*r things*r than*r these.”*r
And he said to him, “Truly,*r truly,*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r you*r will*r see*r heaven*r opened,*r and*r the*r angels*r of*r God*r ascending*r and*r descending*r on*r the*r Son*r of*r Man.”*r
John 2
The Wedding at Cana
On*p the third day there was a wedding at Cana in Galilee, and the mother of Jesus was there.
Jesus also was invited to the wedding with his disciples.
When the wine ran out, the mother of Jesus said to him, “They have no wine.”
And Jesus said to her, “Woman,*r what*r does*r this*r have*r to*r do*r with*r me?*r My*r hour*r has*r not*r yet*r come.”*r
His mother said to the servants, “Do whatever he tells you.”
Now*p there were six stone water jars there for the Jewish rites of purification, each holding twenty or thirty gallons.
Jesus said to the servants, “Fill*r the*r jars*r with*r water.”*r And they filled them up to the brim.
And he said to them, “Now*r draw*r some*r out*r and*r take*r it*r to*r the*r master*r of*r the*r feast.”*r So they took it.
When the master of the feast tasted the water now become wine, and did not know where it came from (though the servants who had drawn the water knew), the master of the feast called the bridegroom
and said to him, “Everyone serves the good wine first, and when people have drunk freely, then the poor wine. But you have kept the good wine until now.”
This, the first of his signs, Jesus did at Cana in Galilee, and manifested his glory. And his disciples believed in him.
After*p this he went down to Capernaum, with his mother and his brothers and his disciples, and they stayed there for a few days.
Jesus Cleanses the Temple
The*p Passover of the Jews was at hand, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem.
In the temple he found those who were selling oxen and sheep and pigeons, and the money-changers sitting there.
And making a whip of cords, he drove them all out of the temple, with the sheep and oxen. And he poured out the coins of the money-changers and overturned their tables.
And he told those who sold the pigeons, “Take*r these*r things*r away;*r do*r not*r make*r my*r Father’s*r house*r a*r house*r of*r trade.”*r
His disciples remembered that it was written, “Zeal for your house will consume me.”
So*p the Jews said to him, “What sign do you show us for doing these things?”
Jesus answered them, “Destroy*r this*r temple,*r and*r in*r three*r days*r I*r will*r raise*r it*r up.”*r
The Jews then said, “It has taken forty-six years to build this temple, and will you raise it up in three days?”
But he was speaking about the temple of his body.
When therefore he was raised from the dead, his disciples remembered that he had said this, and they believed the Scripture and the word that Jesus had spoken.
Jesus Knows What Is in Man
Now*p when he was in Jerusalem at the Passover Feast, many believed in his name when they saw the signs that he was doing.
But Jesus on his part did not entrust himself to them, because he knew all people
and needed no one to bear witness about man, for he himself knew what was in man.
John 3
You Must Be Born Again
Now*p there was a man of the Pharisees named Nicodemus, a ruler of the Jews.
This man came to Jesus by night and said to him, “Rabbi, we know that you are a teacher come from God, for no one can do these signs that you do unless God is with him.”
Jesus answered him, “Truly,*r truly,*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r unless*r one*r is*r born*r again*r he*r cannot*r see*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God.”*r
Nicodemus said to him, “How can a man be born when he is old? Can he enter a second time into his mother’s womb and be born?”
Jesus answered, “Truly,*r truly,*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r unless*r one*r is*r born*r of*r water*r and*r the*r Spirit,*r he*r cannot*r enter*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God.*r
That*r which*r is*r born*r of*r the*r flesh*r is*r flesh,*r and*r that*r which*r is*r born*r of*r the*r Spirit*r is*r spirit.*r
Do*r not*r marvel*r that*r I*r said*r to*r you,*r ‘You*r must*r be*r born*r again.’*r

The*r wind*r blows*r where*r it*r wishes,*r and*r you*r hear*r its*r sound,*r but*r you*r do*r not*r know*r where*r it*r comes*r from*r or*r where*r it*r goes.*r So*r it*r is*r with*r everyone*r who*r is*r born*r of*r the*r Spirit.”*r
Nicodemus*p said to him, “How can these things be?”
Jesus answered him, “Are*r you*r the*r teacher*r of*r Israel*r and*r yet*r you*r do*r not*r understand*r these*r things?*r
Truly,*r truly,*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r we*r speak*r of*r what*r we*r know,*r and*r bear*r witness*r to*r what*r we*r have*r seen,*r but*r you*r do*r not*r receive*r our*r testimony.*r
If*r I*r have*r told*r you*r earthly*r things*r and*r you*r do*r not*r believe,*r how*r can*r you*r believe*r if*r I*r tell*r you*r heavenly*r things?*r
No*r one*r has*r ascended*r into*r heaven*r except*r he*r who*r descended*r from*r heaven,*r the*r Son*r of*r Man.*r
And*r as*r Moses*r lifted*r up*r the*r serpent*r in*r the*r wilderness,*r so*r must*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r be*r lifted*r up,*r
that*r whoever*r believes*r in*r him*r may*r have*r eternal*r life.*r
For God So Loved the World
“For*rp God*r so*r loved*r the*r world,*r that*r he*r gave*r his*r only*r Son,*r that*r whoever*r believes*r in*r him*r should*r not*r perish*r but*r have*r eternal*r life.*r
For*r God*r did*r not*r send*r his*r Son*r into*r the*r world*r to*r condemn*r the*r world,*r but*r in*r order*r that*r the*r world*r might*r be*r saved*r through*r him.*r

Whoever*r believes*r in*r him*r is*r not*r condemned,*r but*r whoever*r does*r not*r believe*r is*r condemned*r already,*r because*r he*r has*r not*r believed*r in*r the*r name*r of*r the*r only*r Son*r of*r God.*r
And*r this*r is*r the*r judgment:*r the*r light*r has*r come*r into*r the*r world,*r and*r people*r loved*r the*r darkness*r rather*r than*r the*r light*r because*r their*r works*r were*r evil.*r
For*r everyone*r who*r does*r wicked*r things*r hates*r the*r light*r and*r does*r not*r come*r to*r the*r light,*r lest*r his*r works*r should*r be*r exposed.*r
But*r whoever*r does*r what*r is*r true*r comes*r to*r the*r light,*r so*r that*r it*r may*r be*r clearly*r seen*r that*r his*r works*r have*r been*r carried*r out*r in*r God.”*r
John the Baptist Exalts Christ
After*p this Jesus and his disciples went into the Judean countryside, and he remained there with them and was baptizing.
John also was baptizing at Aenon near Salim, because water was plentiful there, and people were coming and being baptized
(for John had not yet been put in prison).
Now*p a discussion arose between some of John’s disciples and a Jew over purification.
And they came to John and said to him, “Rabbi, he who was with you across the Jordan, to whom you bore witness— look, he is baptizing, and all are going to him.”
John answered, “A person cannot receive even one thing unless it is given him from heaven.
You yourselves bear me witness, that I said, ‘I am not the Christ, but I have been sent before him.’
The one who has the bride is the bridegroom. The friend of the bridegroom, who stands and hears him, rejoices greatly at the bridegroom’s voice. Therefore this joy of mine is now complete.
He must increase, but I must decrease.”
He*p who comes from above is above all. He who is of the earth belongs to the earth and speaks in an earthly way. He who comes from heaven is above all.
He bears witness to what he has seen and heard, yet no one receives his testimony.
Whoever receives his testimony sets his seal to this, that God is true.
For he whom God has sent utters the words of God, for he gives the Spirit without measure.
The Father loves the Son and has given all things into his hand.
Whoever believes in the Son has eternal life; whoever does not obey the Son shall not see life, but the wrath of God remains on him.
John 4
Jesus and the Woman of Samaria
Now*p when Jesus learned that the Pharisees had heard that Jesus was making and baptizing more disciples than John
(although Jesus himself did not baptize, but only his disciples),
he left Judea and departed again for Galilee.
And he had to pass through Samaria.
So he came to a town of Samaria called Sychar, near the field that Jacob had given to his son Joseph.
Jacob’s well was there; so Jesus, wearied as he was from his journey, was sitting beside the well. It was about the sixth hour.
A*p woman from Samaria came to draw water. Jesus said to her, “Give*r me*r a*r drink.”*r
(For his disciples had gone away into the city to buy food.)
The Samaritan woman said to him, “How is it that you, a Jew, ask for a drink from me, a woman of Samaria?” (For Jews have no dealings with Samaritans.)

Jesus answered her, “If*r you*r knew*r the*r gift*r of*r God,*r and*r who*r it*r is*r that*r is*r saying*r to*r you,*r ‘Give*r me*r a*r drink,’*r you*r would*r have*r asked*r him,*r and*r he*r would*r have*r given*r you*r living*r water.”*r
The woman said to him, “Sir, you have nothing to draw water with, and the well is deep. Where do you get that living water?
Are you greater than our father Jacob? He gave us the well and drank from it himself, as did his sons and his livestock.”
Jesus said to her, “Everyone*r who*r drinks*r of*r this*r water*r will*r be*r thirsty*r again,*r

but*r whoever*r drinks*r of*r the*r water*r that*r I*r will*r give*r him*r will*r never*r be*r thirsty*r again.*r The*r water*r that*r I*r will*r give*r him*r will*r become*r in*r him*r a*r spring*r of*r water*r welling*r up*r to*r eternal*r life.”*r
The woman said to him, “Sir, give me this water, so that I will not be thirsty or have to come here to draw water.”
Jesus*p said to her, “Go,*r call*r your*r husband,*r and*r come*r here.”*r
The woman answered him, “I have no husband.” Jesus said to her, “You*r are*r right*r in*r saying,*r ‘I*r have*r no*r husband’;*r
for*r you*r have*r had*r five*r husbands,*r and*r the*r one*r you*r now*r have*r is*r not*r your*r husband.*r What*r you*r have*r said*r is*r true.”*r
The woman said to him, “Sir, I perceive that you are a prophet.
Our fathers worshiped on this mountain, but you say that in Jerusalem is the place where people ought to worship.”
Jesus said to her, “Woman,*r believe*r me,*r the*r hour*r is*r coming*r when*r neither*r on*r this*r mountain*r nor*r in*r Jerusalem*r will*r you*r worship*r the*r Father.*r
You*r worship*r what*r you*r do*r not*r know;*r we*r worship*r what*r we*r know,*r for*r salvation*r is*r from*r the*r Jews.*r

But*r the*r hour*r is*r coming,*r and*r is*r now*r here,*r when*r the*r true*r worshipers*r will*r worship*r the*r Father*r in*r spirit*r and*r truth,*r for*r the*r Father*r is*r seeking*r such*r people*r to*r worship*r him.*r
God*r is*r spirit,*r and*r those*r who*r worship*r him*r must*r worship*r in*r spirit*r and*r truth.”*r
The woman said to him, “I know that Messiah is coming (he who is called Christ). When he comes, he will tell us all things.”
Jesus said to her, “I*r who*r speak*r to*r you*r am*r he.”*r
Just*p then his disciples came back. They marveled that he was talking with a woman, but no one said, “What do you seek?” or, “Why are you talking with her?”
So the woman left her water jar and went away into town and said to the people,
“Come, see a man who told me all that I ever did. Can this be the Christ?”
They went out of the town and were coming to him.
Meanwhile*p the disciples were urging him, saying, “Rabbi, eat.”
But he said to them, “I*r have*r food*r to*r eat*r that*r you*r do*r not*r know*r about.”*r
So the disciples said to one another, “Has anyone brought him something to eat?”
Jesus said to them, “My*r food*r is*r to*r do*r the*r will*r of*r him*r who*r sent*r me*r and*r to*r accomplish*r his*r work.*r

Do*r you*r not*r say,*r ‘There*r are*r yet*r four*r months,*r then*r comes*r the*r harvest’?*r Look,*r I*r tell*r you,*r lift*r up*r your*r eyes,*r and*r see*r that*r the*r fields*r are*r white*r for*r harvest.*r
Already*r the*r one*r who*r reaps*r is*r receiving*r wages*r and*r gathering*r fruit*r for*r eternal*r life,*r so*r that*r sower*r and*r reaper*r may*r rejoice*r together.*r
For*r here*r the*r saying*r holds*r true,*r ‘One*r sows*r and*r another*r reaps.’*r
I*r sent*r you*r to*r reap*r that*r for*r which*r you*r did*r not*r labor.*r Others*r have*r labored,*r and*r you*r have*r entered*r into*r their*r labor.”*r
Many*p Samaritans from that town believed in him because of the woman’s testimony, “He told me all that I ever did.”
So when the Samaritans came to him, they asked him to stay with them, and he stayed there two days.
And many more believed because of his word.
They said to the woman, “It is no longer because of what you said that we believe, for we have heard for ourselves, and we know that this is indeed the Savior of the world.”
After*p the two days he departed for Galilee.
(For Jesus himself had testified that a prophet has no honor in his own hometown.)
So when he came to Galilee, the Galileans welcomed him, having seen all that he had done in Jerusalem at the feast. For they too had gone to the feast.
Jesus Heals an Official’s Son
So*p he came again to Cana in Galilee, where he had made the water wine. And at Capernaum there was an official whose son was ill.
When this man heard that Jesus had come from Judea to Galilee, he went to him and asked him to come down and heal his son, for he was at the point of death.
So Jesus said to him, “Unless*r you*r see*r signs*r and*r wonders*r you*r will*r not*r believe.”*r
The official said to him, “Sir, come down before my child dies.”
Jesus said to him, “Go;*r your*r son*r will*r live.”*r The man believed the word that Jesus spoke to him and went on his way.
As he was going down, his servants met him and told him that his son was recovering.
So he asked them the hour when he began to get better, and they said to him, “Yesterday at the seventh hour the fever left him.”
The father knew that was the hour when Jesus had said to him, “Your*r son*r will*r live.”*r And he himself believed, and all his household.
This was now the second sign that Jesus did when he had come from Judea to Galilee.
John 5
The Healing at the Pool on the Sabbath
After*p this there was a feast of the Jews, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem.
Now*p there is in Jerusalem by the Sheep Gate a pool, in Aramaic called Bethesda, which has five roofed colonnades.
In these lay a multitude of invalids— blind, lame, and paralyzed.
One man was there who had been an invalid for thirty-eight years.
When Jesus saw him lying there and knew that he had already been there a long time, he said to him, “Do*r you*r want*r to*r be*r healed?”*r
The sick man answered him, “Sir, I have no one to put me into the pool when the water is stirred up, and while I am going another steps down before me.”
Jesus said to him, “Get*r up,*r take*r up*r your*r bed,*r and*r walk.”*r
And at once the man was healed, and he took up his bed and walked. Now*p that day was the Sabbath.
So the Jews said to the man who had been healed, “It is the Sabbath, and it is not lawful for you to take up your bed.”
But he answered them, “The man who healed me, that man said to me, ‘Take*r up*r your*r bed,*r and*r walk.’”*r
They asked him, “Who is the man who said to you, ‘Take up your bed and walk’?”
Now the man who had been healed did not know who it was, for Jesus had withdrawn, as there was a crowd in the place.
Afterward Jesus found him in the temple and said to him, “See,*r you*r are*r well!*r Sin*r no*r more,*r that*r nothing*r worse*r may*r happen*r to*r you.”*r
The man went away and told the Jews that it was Jesus who had healed him.
And this was why the Jews were persecuting Jesus, because he was doing these things on the Sabbath.
But Jesus answered them, “My*r Father*r is*r working*r until*r now,*r and*r I*r am*r working.”*r
Jesus Is Equal with God
This*p was why the Jews were seeking all the more to kill him, because not only was he breaking the Sabbath, but he was even calling God his own Father, making himself equal with God.
The Authority of the Son

So*p Jesus said to them, “Truly,*r truly,*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r the*r Son*r can*r do*r nothing*r of*r his*r own*r accord,*r but*r only*r what*r he*r sees*r the*r Father*r doing.*r For*r whatever*r the*r Father*r does,*r that*r the*r Son*r does*r likewise.*r

For*r the*r Father*r loves*r the*r Son*r and*r shows*r him*r all*r that*r he*r himself*r is*r doing.*r And*r greater*r works*r than*r these*r will*r he*r show*r him,*r so*r that*r you*r may*r marvel.*r
For*r as*r the*r Father*r raises*r the*r dead*r and*r gives*r them*r life,*r so*r also*r the*r Son*r gives*r life*r to*r whom*r he*r will.*r
For*r the*r Father*r judges*r no*r one,*r but*r has*r given*r all*r judgment*r to*r the*r Son,*r
that*r all*r may*r honor*r the*r Son,*r just*r as*r they*r honor*r the*r Father.*r Whoever*r does*r not*r honor*r the*r Son*r does*r not*r honor*r the*r Father*r who*r sent*r him.*r

Truly,*r truly,*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r whoever*r hears*r my*r word*r and*r believes*r him*r who*r sent*r me*r has*r eternal*r life.*r He*r does*r not*r come*r into*r judgment,*r but*r has*r passed*r from*r death*r to*r life.*r

“Truly,*rp truly,*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r an*r hour*r is*r coming,*r and*r is*r now*r here,*r when*r the*r dead*r will*r hear*r the*r voice*r of*r the*r Son*r of*r God,*r and*r those*r who*r hear*r will*r live.*r
For*r as*r the*r Father*r has*r life*r in*r himself,*r so*r he*r has*r granted*r the*r Son*r also*r to*r have*r life*r in*r himself.*r
And*r he*r has*r given*r him*r authority*r to*r execute*r judgment,*r because*r he*r is*r the*r Son*r of*r Man.*r
Do*r not*r marvel*r at*r this,*r for*r an*r hour*r is*r coming*r when*r all*r who*r are*r in*r the*r tombs*r will*r hear*r his*r voice*r
and*r come*r out,*r those*r who*r have*r done*r good*r to*r the*r resurrection*r of*r life,*r and*r those*r who*r have*r done*r evil*r to*r the*r resurrection*r of*r judgment.*r
Witnesses to Jesus

“I*rp can*r do*r nothing*r on*r my*r own.*r As*r I*r hear,*r I*r judge,*r and*r my*r judgment*r is*r just,*r because*r I*r seek*r not*r my*r own*r will*r but*r the*r will*r of*r him*r who*r sent*r me.*r
If*r I*r alone*r bear*r witness*r about*r myself,*r my*r testimony*r is*r not*r true.*r
There*r is*r another*r who*r bears*r witness*r about*r me,*r and*r I*r know*r that*r the*r testimony*r that*r he*r bears*r about*r me*r is*r true.*r
You*r sent*r to*r John,*r and*r he*r has*r borne*r witness*r to*r the*r truth.*r
Not*r that*r the*r testimony*r that*r I*r receive*r is*r from*r man,*r but*r I*r say*r these*r things*r so*r that*r you*r may*r be*r saved.*r

Jesus said to them, “Children,*r do*r you*r have*r any*r fish?”*r They answered him, “No.”

He said to them, “Cast*r the*r net*r on*r the*r right*r side*r of*r the*r boat,*r and*r you*r will*r find*r some.”*r So they cast it, and now they were not able to haul it in, because of the quantity of fish.

That disciple whom Jesus loved therefore said to Peter, “It is the Lord!” When Simon Peter heard that it was the Lord, he put on his outer garment, for he was stripped for work, and threw himself into the sea.
The other disciples came in the boat, dragging the net full of fish, for they were not far from the land, but about a hundred yards off.
When*p they got out on land, they saw a charcoal fire in place, with fish laid out on it, and bread.

So Simon Peter went aboard and hauled the net ashore, full of large fish, 153 of them. And although there were so many, the net was not torn.

Jesus came and took the bread and gave it to them, and so with the fish.
This was now the third time that Jesus was revealed to the disciples after he was raised from the dead.
Jesus and Peter

When*p they had finished breakfast, Jesus said to Simon Peter, “Simon,*r son*r of*r John,*r do*r you*r love*r me*r more*r than*r these?”*r He said to him, “Yes, Lord; you know that I love you.” He said to him, “Feed*r my*r lambs.”*r

Truly,*r truly,*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r when*r you*r were*r young,*r you*r used*r to*r dress*r yourself*r and*r walk*r wherever*r you*r wanted,*r but*r when*r you*r are*r old,*r you*r will*r stretch*r out*r your*r hands,*r and*r another*r will*r dress*r you*r and*r carry*r you*r where*r you*r do*r not*r want*r to*r go.”*r
(This he said to show by what kind of death he was to glorify God.) And after saying this he said to him, “Follow*r me.”*r
Jesus and the Beloved Apostle
Peter*p turned and saw the disciple whom Jesus loved following them, the one who also had leaned back against him during the supper and had said, “Lord, who is it that is going to betray you?”
